metadata.title: CVE-2016-7076 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
sudo before version 1.8.18p1 is vulnerable to a bypass in the sudo noexecrestriction if application run via sudo executed wordexp() C libraryfunction with a user supplied argument. A local user permitted to run suchapplication via sudo with noexec restriction could possibly use this flawto execute arbitrary commands with elevated privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7076` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sudo - 1.8.19p1-1ubuntu1
sudo-ldap - 1.8.19p1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sudo package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.19p1-1ubuntu1').
